dataset.title: Lithology per SASAP region and Hydrologic Unit (HUC8) boundaries for Alaskan watersheds

creator.organizationName: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis
National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis

abstract.para: This dataset was created to identify the dominant rock type of each SASAP region and each HUC8 watershed of Alaska. The Global Lithology Map (GliM) from the University of Hamburg (Hartmann, Jörg; Moosdorf, Nils (2012): Global Lithological Map Database v1.0 (gridded to 0.5° spatial resolution). PANGAEA, https://doi.org/10.1594/PANGAEA.788537, License: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported) was combined with the "sasap_regions.zip" shapefile (located here: https://knb.ecoinformatics.org/#view/urn:uuid:2c1c26fc-bfb9-4b6a-8d4a-0be8e61c4deb) to create "Lithology_shp_regions.zip", a shapefile that contains measurements of the area covered by certain lithologies in each SASAP region. It was also combined with the "sasap_watersheds_gapfix.zip" shapefile (located here: https://knb.ecoinformatics.org/#view/urn:uuid:2b5ab57e-38ec-4bc9-8290-f080ec0befb4) to create "Lithology_shp_watersheds.zip", a shapefile that contains measurements of the area covered by certain lithologies in each Alaskan watershed. CSV versions of the resulting shapefiles are also archived. The included python script, which was used to merge the data, outlines the process in more detail.

intellectualRights.para: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Alaska Peninsula and Aleutian Islands, Alaska

contact.organizationName: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)

description.para: The included python script was used to subset and merge the datasets into the two shapefile datasets and the csv files.

project.title: State of Alaska's Salmon and People

abstract.para: State of Alaska's Salmon and People (SASAP) and SASAP Data Task Force are both funded by the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation. SASAP is a synthesis science project aimed to create an equitable decision-making platform for all stakeholders by addressing data gaps in Alaska's salmon system through information synthesis, collaboration and stakeholder engagement. The SASAP Data Task Force assists the synthesis research effort through data collection, homogenization, management, and sustainability, under the direction of the synthesis project leads. The result of the efforts of these two projects is an Alaskan Salmon data catalog, containing all of the original and derived data products resulting from the synthesis research.

funding.para: State of Alaska's Salmon and People (Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation Award 5124)
Data Task Forces for Better Synthesis Studies (Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation Award 5451)

dataTable.entityDescription: This is a csv version of the included "Lithology_shp_regions.zip" shapefile with the geometry field removed. Each row corresponds to a region and contains measurements of the area covered by the following lithologies: Siliciclastic Sedimentary Rocks, Mixed Sedimentary Rocks, Unconsolidated Sediment, Carbonate Sedimentary Rocks, Pyroclastics, Evaporites, Metamorphic Rock, Acid Plutonic Rocks, Intermediate Plutonic Rocks, Basic Plutonic Rocks, Acid Volcanic Rocks, Intermediate Volcanic Rocks, Basic Volcanic Rocks, Ice and Glaciers, and Water Bodies

attribute.attributeDefinition: The numeric identification number of the region

textDomain.definition: The numeric identification number of the region

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the region
The area covered by Evaporites
The area covered by Ice and Glaciers
The area covered by Metamorphic Rock

The area covered by Intermediate Plutonic Rocks
The area covered by Pyroclastics
The area covered by Carbonate Sedimentary Rocks
The area covered by Mixed Sedimentary Rocks
The area covered by Siliciclastic Sedimentary Rocks
The area covered by Unconsolidated Sediment
The area covered by Acid Volcanic Rocks
The area covered by Basic Volcanic Rocks
The area covered by Intermediate Volcanic Rocks
The area covered by Water Bodies
The area covered by the lithology that covers the most area in the region
The abbreviated name of the lithology that covers the most area in the region

spatialVector.entityDescription: This shapefile contains measurements of the area covered by the following lithologies within various regions: Siliciclastic Sedimentary Rocks, Mixed Sedimentary Rocks, Unconsolidated Sediment, Carbonate Sedimentary Rocks, Pyroclastics, Evaporites, Metamorphic Rock, Acid Plutonic Rocks, Intermediate Plutonic Rocks, Basic Plutonic Rocks, Acid Volcanic Rocks, Intermediate Volcanic Rocks, Basic Volcanic Rocks, Ice and Glaciers, and Water Bodies. Zip contains .shp, .shx, .dbf, .cpg, and .prj files.

otherEntity.entityDescription: This python script was used to subset and merge the source data with the region data and with the watershed data to create the region and watershed shapefiles and csv files.
